Collaboration and team productivity tools have become essential for streamlining workflows, enhancing communication, and driving efficiency across organisations. These tools empower teams to work together seamlessly, whether in the office or remotely, enabling businesses to innovate, adapt, and deliver value more effectively.

In this week’s edition of Tech Tuesday, we explore some of the top collaboration and productivity tools designed to meet the unique needs of SMEs, helping them optimise teamwork and stay competitive in an evolving digital landscape.

Lucid Software has introduced new features aimed at improving agile workflows for teams and organisations. The updates include tools for both team-level and program-level planning. For team-level collaboration, new features like private mode for anonymous input and virtual team spaces help teams stay connected and organised, even when working remotely. At the program level, big room planning templates support collaboration across multiple teams, helping organisations manage large projects and coordinate efforts.

Oracle Aconex is a construction management platform designed to connect teams and streamline collaboration across the entire project lifecycle. With a flexible process management engine, Aconex allows teams of all sizes to manage workflows and maintain a permanent audit trail. As a neutral system, Aconex supports seamless data exchange and ensures that all project stakeholders work from a single, reliable source of information. This approach helps mitigate risks and promotes transparency, ensuring that project data remains complete, accurate, and accessible, regardless of challenges faced during construction.

monday.com is a low-code/no-code platform that enables organisations to run all core aspects of work.Through its core platform, monday.com is leading the way in a new category of software that is set to transform how people work and businesses operate, helping teams manage all projects and tasks from a single, centralised location. On top of the platform, monday.com has built a product suite to address the needs of specific industries –– including monday work management, monday sales CRM, monday dev, and monday service.  The flexibility of monday.com empowers its +225,000 customers to run thousands of use cases — building business-critical software applications and work management tools, acting as a connective layer to form a unified workplace, and integrating applications across an organisation. This enables teams across any industry to boost productivity, nail deadlines, and collaborate together with ease while linking departments and bridging information silos.

The UiPath Platform enhances collaboration and productivity by leveraging agentic automation, enabling autonomous agents to optimize workflows. These self-learning tools allow employees to focus on high-value tasks like product innovation and improving client experiences.Seamlessly integrated with CRM and ERP systems, UiPath supports real-time collaboration across various business functions, including finance, HR, marketing, and operations. It provides automation solutions for industries such as public sector, education, finance, retail, and manufacturing. In Australia, companies like RSM Australia and Griffith University are seeing significant returns on investment and improved efficiency through the UiPath Platform, helping them drive new growth initiatives.

NetSuite Analytics Warehouse (NSAW) is a cloud-based data analytics platform built for NetSuite users. It integrates data from various sources, such as NetSuite, legacy systems, and third-party platforms like Salesforce, WooCommerce, shop floor machinery apps, to provide real-time insights and facilitate team collaboration. Using AI and machine learning, NSAW helps businesses streamline data management and make faster, data-driven decisions through customisable dashboards and visualisations.

NetSuite Analytics Warehouse (NSAW) is currently transforming industries like finance, professional services, venue management, manufacturing, and wholesale distribution by improvingproductivity, enabling collaboration, and reducing reliance on IT for reporting. It empowers teams with insights that foster collaborations and better decision-making across departments.

Aristotle Metadata Registry boosts collaboration and team productivity by streamlining how users work together to document and manage data. The platform simplifies locating, securing, and utilising data, improving workflow efficiency while reducing risk and enhancing data governance across teams.

By connecting business, IT, and governance teams through customisable workflows, automation, and user controls, Aristotle empowers users to work cohesively. It offers executives clear insights into how their teams handle data assets and ensures productive collaboration on key data-driven projects. While Aristotle has seen success in government and healthcare, it’s now fostering collaboration in industries like market research and finance, where data management and trust are critical.
